summary: This is a formal U.S. Department of Justice request to Swedish authorities for assistance in interviewing a witness (EIM) residing in Sweden. The witness is believed to have information relevant to the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minors and the possible criminal actions of his associates. The request emphasizes confidentiality and outlines the legal statutes under investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a U.S. citizen alleged to have engaged in the sexual abuse of minor girls from approximately 1995 to 2005. He was charged with sex trafficking in July 2019 and committed suicide in August 2019 while awaiting trial.

persons.name: EIM
persons.context: An individual living in Sweden who may be a witness to events, conduct, or conversations relevant to the U.S. investigation into sexual misconduct with minors. She is a Swedish citizen, not a target, and has indicated willingness to be interviewed voluntarily.

connections.description: EIM is identified as a witness who may have observed events, conduct, or conversations relevant to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's alleged sexual abuse of minors.

The document states one of Epstein's victims alleged misconduct involving one or more of Epstein's associates, and that EIM was a witness to certain of the victim's interactions with Epstein and his associates.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse by Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is alleged to have engaged in the sexual abuse of minor girls during this approximate period.

events.title: Epstein Charged with Sex Trafficking
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with sex trafficking of minors in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide while awaiting trial.

events.title: Planned Interview of Witness EIM
events.description: EIM has indicated willingness to consent to a voluntary interview with U.S. authorities on this date.

keyFacts: The U.S. is actively investigating 'possible criminal actions by certain of Epstein's associates' as of January 2020, indicating the investigation extended beyond Epstein himself after his death.

One of Epstein's victims has alleged misconduct involving one or more of Epstein's associates, and witness EIM was reportedly present for some of the victim's interactions with Epstein and these associates.
The U.S. request is made under the 2001 U.S.-Sweden Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty and emphasizes strict confidentiality to prevent disclosure to potential subjects of the investigation.
The legal statutes cited as the basis for the investigation are 18 U.S.C. ยง 1591 (Sex Trafficking of Minors), ยง 2423 (Transportation of Minors), and ยง 2422 (Coercion and Enticement).
The witness, EIM, is a Swedish citizen residing in Sweden, is not a target of the investigation, and has communicated directly with U.S. authorities to arrange the voluntary interview.
